content:
• Tuesday, December 27, 2011
  • EMKR

    Solar panel maker Emcore (NASDAQ:EMKR) trades down in the post-session after its Q4 EPS losses...

    Solar panel maker Emcore (NASDAQ:EMKR) trades down in the post-session after its Q4 EPS losses were much deeper than anticipated. Losses widened as its operations were curtailed by the flooding in Thailand during October, with the company noting the manufacturing infrastructure that supports roughly half of its fiber-optics segment revenue was heavily damaged. Shares -5.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:44 PM | 4 Comments
  • BLDP

    Fuel cell developer Ballard Power (NASDAQ:BLDP) rises 4.7% AH after announcing it has signed a...

    Fuel cell developer Ballard Power (NASDAQ:BLDP) rises 4.7% AH after announcing it has signed a letter of intent with the city of Sao Paolo, Brazil to deliver fuel cell modules for 25 city buses in 2012. The deal comes 2 weeks after Ballard inked a supply agreement with European bus manufacturer Van Hool NV.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM
  • BHC

    Medicis Pharmaceutical (MRX) guides its Q4 lower, now saying that it expects revenues to be in...

    Medicis Pharmaceutical (MRX) guides its Q4 lower, now saying that it expects revenues to be in the range of $170M - $183M, down from its previous range of $187M - $200M and below Street estimates of $190M. The company also said that it expects a decrease in its EPS to a range of $0.51 - $0.57. The company attributes the lowered numbers to expenses related to the implementation of new strategic initiatives. Shares -3.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:26 PM
  • NYT

    The New York Times (NYSE:NYT) gains 1.7% AH after announcing it has agreed to sell its Regional...

    The New York Times (NYSE:NYT) gains 1.7% AH after announcing it has agreed to sell its Regional Media Group, which owns 16 regional newspapers and various other publications, to privately-owned Halifax Media Holdings for $143M in cash ($150M in post-tax proceeds). The transaction is expected to close in Q1 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:22 PM
  • MRVL

    Cavium (CAVM) resumes trading after warning Q4 revenue will fall short of consensus. Shares -7% AH.

    Cavium (CAVM) resumes trading after warning Q4 revenue will fall short of consensus. Shares -7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • AIG

    AIG gains 1.5% AH after the WSJ reports a federal judge approved a $450M settlement between the...

    AIG gains 1.5% AH after the WSJ reports a federal judge approved a $450M settlement between the company and rival insurers. The settlement addresses claims AIG had incorrectly reported the size of its workers' compensation business in the 1980s and 1990s, which in turn allowed it to make smaller contributions to state-mandated pools for uninsured workers. (previously)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM
  • MRVL

    Cavium (CAVM) becomes the latest chipmaker to issue a Q4 warning: the company now expects...

    Cavium (CAVM) becomes the latest chipmaker to issue a Q4 warning: the company now expects revenue of $56M-$57M for the quarter, below a $61.6M consensus. Cavium blames weak demand from a variety of market segments, as well as a "hub transition" at a major customer (most likely Cisco). Shares are halted, and will resume trading at 4:30.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM | 2 Comments
  • ITP

    Chinese paper manufacturer Orient Paper (ONP +7.9%) pops after saying late Friday that it hired...

    Chinese paper manufacturer Orient Paper (ONP +7.9%) pops after saying late Friday that it hired BDO China Shu Lun Pan as its independent public accounting firm, after dismissing BDO Limited Hong Kong earlier in the week. Separately, the company also notes it's completed all testing operations and launched commercial production of its new corrugating medium paper production line.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • MCPIQ

    Rare earth miners are selling off following the Chinese government's establishing of 2012 export...

    Rare earth miners are selling off following the Chinese government's establishing of 2012 export quotas. MCP -3.4%. REE -4.9%. TC -3.3%. JPMorgan thinks the quotas "could put additional pressure on rare earth prices," after taking into account expected production increases from Molycorp and Lynas.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • KGC

    Gold stocks are lower today after the yellow metal futures contract closed $10 an ounce lower,...

    Gold stocks are lower today after the yellow metal futures contract closed $10 an ounce lower, racking up four straight losing sessions in a row: Kinross (KGC -1.9%), Barrick (ABX -1.1%), Newmont Mining (NEM -0.7%), Agnico Eagle Mines (AEM -1.8%), Goldcorp (GG -1.6%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM
  • NSPH

    Shares of Nanosphere (NSPH +28.1%) pop after the firm announces FDA clearance for its BC-S test...

    Shares of Nanosphere (NSPH +28.1%) pop after the firm announces FDA clearance for its BC-S test that can help rapidly identify bloodstream infections. The firm says the test was submitted to the FDA as the first phase of an extended process to obtain clearance for a larger test panel.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:01 PM
  • SSRI

    Silver Standard (SSRI -3.8%) dips after the company filed a disappointing technical report on...

    Silver Standard (SSRI -3.8%) dips after the company filed a disappointing technical report on the updated mineral resources and reserve estimates for its Pirquitas Mine late Friday.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • RPRX

    Repros Therapeutics (RPRX +3.3%) moves higher after providing a status update for the one year...

    Repros Therapeutics (RPRX +3.3%) moves higher after providing a status update for the one year open label extension of its Phase II clinical study of Androxal, an oral therapy designed to treat low testosterone in men.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:36 PM | 1 Comment
  • F

    Though the Conference Board found overall consumer confidence to be strong, it also reported...

    Though the Conference Board found overall consumer confidence to be strong, it also reported only 9.8% of surveyed consumers planned to buy a car in the next 6 month - the lowest number posted since Oct. 2010. That, in turn, is leading to weakness in the shares of major automakers. F -1.2%. GM -1.5%. TM -0.6%. HMC -1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:27 PM | 1 Comment
  • ARIA

    Ariad Pharmaceuticals (ARIA +6.2%) trades higher after catching positive comments and a price...

    Ariad Pharmaceuticals (ARIA +6.2%) trades higher after catching positive comments and a price target increase from Rodman & Renshaw. In a report to clients, analysts note that the potential of the firm's ponatinib treatment remains untapped and other drugs in the pipeline should also be catalysts.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM
  • CVLT

    CommVault Systems (CVLT +4.1%) moves up today after RBC upgrades the stock to its Top Pick list...

    CommVault Systems (CVLT +4.1%) moves up today after RBC upgrades the stock to its Top Pick list on valuation, saying the company has a number of large deals in the pipeline, and is likely to refresh its product line during the coming year.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • CVX

    Oil shares gain as crude breaches the $100 mark: Chevron (CVX +0.6%), Occidental Petroleum (OXY...

    Oil shares gain as crude breaches the $100 mark: Chevron (CVX +0.6%), Occidental Petroleum (OXY +0.9%), Hess (HES +0.6%), Haliburton (HAL +1.4%)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM | 2 Comments
  • TRIP

    Shares of TripAdvisor (NASDAQ:TRIP) fall back 4.2% after CEO Stephen Kaufer unloads on Google in...

    Shares of TripAdvisor (NASDAQ:TRIP) fall back 4.2% after CEO Stephen Kaufer unloads on Google in an interview with Boston Business Journal. He accuses the search giant of "stealing" user reviews and backtracking on its "do no evil" motto by placing its own results at the top of pages for travel-related search queries.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 3 Comments
  • ULTA

    Ulta Salon (ULTA -1.7%) trades lower following a negative mention in Barron's. The publication...

    Ulta Salon (ULTA -1.7%) trades lower following a negative mention in Barron's. The publication argues Ulta's valuation (37x expected FY12 earnings) is excessive, particularly given rising competition. It thinks shares should trade at a relatively modest 20x forward multiple, a level that would translate into a $55 price.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • SHLDQ

    The collapse in Sears (SHLD -23%) is more bad news for Bruce Berkowitz's Fairholme Fund. Already...

    The collapse in Sears (SHLD -23%) is more bad news for Bruce Berkowitz's Fairholme Fund. Already off 32% YTD due to big holdings in financials like AIG, BAC, and C, the fund has 7.9% of its assets in Sears, a 15% stake in the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 2 Comments
  • GILD

    Gilead Sciences (GILD +9%) is in the green after saying late Friday the FDA is reviewing its a...

    Gilead Sciences (GILD +9%) is in the green after saying late Friday the FDA is reviewing its a new drug application for the Quad pill, a complete regimen for treating HIV contained in a single tablet.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • PERF

    Investors aren't taking kindly to Perfumania's (PERF -25.4%) plans to acquire Parlux Fragrances...

    Investors aren't taking kindly to Perfumania's (PERF -25.4%) plans to acquire Parlux Fragrances (PARL +79.1%). Thanks to the crash in Perfumania shares, Parlux's shares are trading at just $6.22 - well below $7.91-$8.55/share range the deal valued Parlux at based on Thursday's close.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • WHR

    The debacle (I, II) at Sears taints shares of Whirlpool (WHR -6.6%) with the concern that fewer...

    The debacle (I, II) at Sears taints shares of Whirlpool (WHR -6.6%) with the concern that fewer Sears stores could translate to less sales of the firm's products.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM | 4 Comments
  • DCTH

    Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH +4.9%) says it's signed an initial launch and training agreement for...

    Delcath Systems (OTC:DCTH +4.9%) says it's signed an initial launch and training agreement for its Chemosat delivery system with Johann Wolfgang Goethe University Hospital, a major European cancer research and treatment center located in Frankfurt, Germany.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • CALM

    Shares of Cal-Maine Foods (CALM +5.1%) trade higher after the company knocks out a big FQ2...

    Shares of Cal-Maine Foods (CALM +5.1%) trade higher after the company knocks out a big FQ2 earnings beat despite production costs that were up 20% Y/Y on corn and soybean price increases.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • BYD

    A just-released Justice Department opinion (.pdf) on online gambling provides a lift to select...

    A just-released Justice Department opinion (.pdf) on online gambling provides a lift to select casino-related stocks after it clarifies that the Wire Act of 1961 only prohibits sports betting - not the whole universe of online gambling. Gainers: BYD +4.4%, PTEK +11%, SGMS +6.8%, MGM +4.5%, WYNN +2.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • DXC

    Computer Sciences (CSC -6.3%) sells off yet again after disclosing it will recognize an...

    Computer Sciences (CSC -6.3%) sells off yet again after disclosing it will recognize an impairment charge as large as $1.5B related to a massive contract with the U.K.'s National Health Service, which the company remains in the process of renegotiating. In addition, citing the uncertainty surrounding the negotiations, Computer Sciences is withdrawing its guidance for FY12 (ends March '12).

     
     
     
     
    | 10:11 AM | 1 Comment
  • MHRCQ

    Magnum Hunter (MHR +13.5%) soars after raising its production guidance for 2011 and 2012. The...

    Magnum Hunter (MHR +13.5%) soars after raising its production guidance for 2011 and 2012. The company says its currently producing at rate of 10K boe per day in 2011 and projects a rate of 14.5K boe per day in 2012 - marking a higher rate than its prior estimate of 13K.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM
  • GERN

    Shares of Geron (NASDAQ:GERN) shoot up 6.4% premarket, helped along by a positive article from...

    Shares of Geron (NASDAQ:GERN) shoot up 6.4% premarket, helped along by a positive article from Jeremy Richards who calls the company a "bargain buy" on the strength of the potential for its stem cell programs.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • SHLDQ

    Market preview: Stock index futures and European shares are a hair lower in slow post-holiday...

    Market preview: Stock index futures and European shares are a hair lower in slow post-holiday action. Sears (SHLD) is off 15% premarket as poor results will lead to the closing of 100-120 stores. The early data shows EU banks took their massive ECB borrowings of last week and deposited the funds right back with the central bank. Later: Consumer Confidence, Richmond Fed, Dallas Fed.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • PARL

    Premarket gainers: PARL +103%. MHR +9%. GERN +6%. MJN +5%. AMR +3%.Losers: SHLD -14%.

    Premarket gainers: PARL +103%. MHR +9%. GERN +6%. MJN +5%. AMR +3%.
    Losers: SHLD -14%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • GPS

    Shares of Gap (NYSE:GPS) get a premarket bounce, up 1.5%, after the firm catches a favorable...

    Shares of Gap (NYSE:GPS) get a premarket bounce, up 1.5%, after the firm catches a favorable cover story in Barron's. After new apparel chains and discounters cut steeply into its market share over the last decade, Gap execs are launching a "well-articulated strategy" of domestic retrenchment along with global expansion.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:48 AM
  • MJN

    Mead Johnson (NYSE:MJN) gains 5.3% premarket following earlier news that testing on its Enfamil...

    Mead Johnson (NYSE:MJN) gains 5.3% premarket following earlier news that testing on its Enfamil formula showed that it's safe.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:19 AM
  • SHLDQ

    Sears (SHLD) falls 4.3% in opening premarket trades following news poor performance will lead to...

    Sears (SHLD) falls 4.3% in opening premarket trades following news poor performance will lead to the closing of 100-120 stores along with $1.6B-$2.4B in Q4 charges.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 AM | 1 Comment
